newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: TRANSNET EX-BOSS GIVEN "DISTURBING" PAYOUT--MARCUS.
newsitem.headline: TRANSNET EX-BOSS GIVEN "DISTURBING" PAYOUT--MARCUS.

text.p: The former managing director of South Africa's state transport network, Transnet, was granted a monthly pension of 62,600 rand, Deputy Finance Minister Gill Marcus said on Wednesday.
Marcus told parliament in a snap debate that Anton Moolman, who was also chairman of the board of trustees of the Transnet pension fund, had also been given a three million rand payout.
The amounts involved were "disturbing", Marcus said.
Transnet's annual report released recently showed a net loss for 1996 of about 253 million and operating profits down 11 percent.
